item.title: Develop a Perl module: Create and Test
item.description: Perl module is a common approach for providing custom sets of functions. But how exactly a module is created, developed, and maintained? In this article, I write down my experience of developing a tiny module named Camellia::Glue.

item.title: Use local modules in Perl5
item.description: In this article, I explain how to write Perl scripts with multiple files.

item.title: Set up WeChat on Linux with Docker
item.description: WeChat is a popular IM (Instant Message) software in China, and is widely used in business situations. However, Tecent, the corporation behind WeChat, serves to provide no support for this popular app in Linux environment.

item.title: It's Time for OS to Rediscover Hardware
item.description: This is a casual notes from the a lecture given by Timothy Roscoe, from ETH Zurich. The recording video of the lecture can be found here.

item.title: SSH to container on remote server
item.description: Containerization is a concept of importance in today’s network service. And Docker is one of the most successful container management tools. This article notes down how I deploy a container on remote, and access it via SSH.

item.title: Status message in M5
item.description: There’s a very interesting part of the gem5 Coding Style document, talking about different message status from M5. I consider them very useful for further work.

item.title: One step into gem5
item.description: “The gem5 simulator is a modular platform for computer-system architecture research, encompassing system-level architecture as well as processor microarchitecture. gem5 is a community led.”

item.title: Insert Image with Markdown
item.description: Images help us better describe our ideas. When I write my blogs, I find two approaches to inserting them. I note down these two in this blog.
